item.title: Mortal Kombat 1: How to Perform Every Kameo Fatality (& What They Look Like)
item.description:
There are plenty of new features and mechanics in Mortal Kombat 1 , but the most notable is definitely the inclusion of Kameo fighters. They're mainly used to string together or break up combos, but can also be called upon to add a little extra pizzazz to throws and Fatal Blows. It's even possible for players to take a step back and let their chosen Kameo fighter land the final blow, with every MK1 Kameo fighter having their own unique Kameo Fatalities.

Those looking to learn how to perform every Kameo Fatality in Mortal Kombat 1 have come to the right place, as this guide not only contains a video showing what each of the finishers is supposed to look like and where players should be standing to trigger them, but also the associated button prompts needed for Switch, Xbox, and PlayStation controllers. The video should also come in handy for anyone who just wants to see what all of the MK1 Kameo Fatalities look like without having to perform them for themselves.

Updated March 18, 2025, by Tom Bowen: In addition to the 15 Kameo fighters found in the base version of the game, Mortal Kombat 1 players gained access to five additional options through the game's first Kombat Pack. No new Kameos were unveiled when Kombat Pack 2 was first announced, although players were eventually treated to Madam Bo, who released alongside the game's final DLC kombatant. This guide has been updated to include Madam Bo's Kameo Fatality, with video and button inputs available here.

The videos featured in this guide contain graphic scenes that have been rated 'Mature' by the ESRB. Viewer discretion is advised.

All of the Mortal Kombat 1 Kameo Fatalities can be performed from medium range, though players may need to stand a little further back to trigger Jax's. Those having trouble finding the exact spot needed can reference the video above for more guidance. In all likelihood though, players shouldn't have too much trouble pulling any of the Fatalities off.

item.title: One Silly New Minecraft Mod Makes The Case For a New Form of DLC
item.description:
A Minecraft player has recently made a fun mod in honor of the upcoming live-action adaptation of the hit survival sandbox game. Over the years, Minecraft has become one of the most notable gaming franchises, and the arrival of A Minecraft Movie is further proof of its hold on pop culture.

The modder goes by SnailMan on Twitter, and their creation now allows players to use Jack Black's voice in the game. Fellow fan Shayy tweeted, "Someone needs to make a pack for Minecraft where every time you pick up an item or hit a mob you get a clip from the movie of Jack Black saying it like this." In a matter of hours, SnailMan delivered, replying, "3 hours of my life that I'll never get back went into making this." With Jack Black taking on the role of Minecraft hero Steve, the movie world and game have now collided, thanks to SnailMan's quick work. This goofy mod is fun enough on its own, but it also makes an argument for official DLC voice packs.

Minecraft Could Be Sitting On a DLC Goldmine With Voice Packs

Thinking Beyond A Minecraft Movie

A Minecraft Movie is set to hit theaters on April 4, 2025.

Of course, a DLC pack that uses the lines of the movie's actors seems like a given. Between Jack Black as Steve and Jason Momoa's role, Minecraft is already working with a deep well of content that it could add to the game with movie-inspired voice packs. However, there is also plenty beyond just the movie that would likely be an even bigger hit with players. Since the game launched, Minecraft has featured a variety of official DLCs and crossovers that can be revamped via voice packs.

Crossover DLCs That Would Be Great With Added Voice Packs

  • Halo
  • Sonic the Hedgehog
  • Steven Universe
  • Toy Story
  • SpongeBob SquarePants
  • Star Wars
  • Avatar: The Last Airbender
  • Kung Fu Panda
  • Moana

Major pop culture franchises have played a part in building Minecraft 's impressive success, and bringing some of the most iconic voice lines to their respective DLC packs could be a great way to make these crossovers that much more enjoyable. Minecraft 's consistent post-launch content has continued to keep fans coming back for more, and it would be fascinating to see how official voice packs were received by players.

Minecraft has sold over 300 million copies, making it one of the best-selling games of all time.

Minecraft's New Approach to Updates Could Benefit Past DLCs

Although it could present hurdles with contracts, Minecraft 's new turn to smaller, more consistent updates could potentially be applied to its existing DLC crossovers, too. Of course, it depends on whether both parties agree to add more to expansions post-launch, but it's not impossible.

However, there is also the issue of voice packs becoming grating over time. Voice packs sound like a fun idea in theory, but hours and hours of hearing the same lines repeated over and over could quickly become mind-numbing. There's always the possibility of disabling them, of course, but it's definitely something that should be considered if developer Mojang ever decides to make voice packs a reality. Minecraft updates keep the game alive, and it would be exciting for voice packs to at least be experimented with.

With Jack Black taking on the role of Minecraft hero Steve, the movie world and game have now collided.

The Arrival of A Minecraft Movie is Imminent

Now that A Minecraft Movie is just a few weeks away, it will be interesting to see audience feedback. The movie is bound to draw in longtime fans and newcomers who only know a little bit about the franchise. A lot of players are skeptical about A Minecraft Movie , which is understandable, since it seems like a difficult game to properly adapt. Only time will tell, but once the movie drops, there are bound to be other mods like SnailMan's.

item.title: Reignbreaker: How to Get Keys and Resolves
item.description:
Like other action roguelikes, you will fight waves of enemies in Reignbreaker to clear stages and move on to the next level. After defeating a group of mechanical monsters, you will get to select Artefacts to buff various stats, including character HP, damage boost, movement speed, and more. However, Artefacts alone are not enough to help you beat the later stages in Reignbreaker .

You will eventually have to unlock Resolve Upgrades and find better Artefacts from hidden Pop-Up Shops. To do both, you will need to collect Resolves and Keys in Reignbreaker . Continue reading this guide to find out how you can get both currencies in the game.

How to Get Resolve and Keys in Reignbreaker

There are a few ways to earn Resolves and Keys in Reignbreaker . The easiest way to get Resolves is by clearing waves of enemies. After clearing all waves, a nearby vault will open, rewarding you with Resolves, Keys, and an option to pick from three Artefacts.

This will be your main source of Resolves and Keys, as you must defeat enemies to unlock the entrance to the next stage.

Apart from beating monsters, you can get Resolves by breaking tall statues and Keys by breaking loot crates . You can identify the statues by their golden shields. Breaking a statue will always reward you with 40-50 Resolves and a health-restoring item that heals you for 20 HP. As for loot crates, they always have golden chains and locks around them. Breaking them will grant you 3-10 Keys.

How to Spend Resolves in Reignbreaker

Resolves are needed to unlock Resolve Upgrades in Reignbreaker . To spend Resolves, go to the Resolve Engine at your base camp. Here, you can unlock new Resolve Upgrades or level up your existing ones. There are three categories of Upgrades available: Survival , Combat , and Utility .

The first tier of Upgrades costs between 100-350 Resolves. You can level up each Upgrade up to level 5 by spending more Resolves. With each level, the cost of upgrading increases. At first, you can only equip three Upgrades at once.

It is recommended to focus on upgrading essential Upgrades, such as Hot and Cold for increased HP or Dasher for an extra Dash.

As you progress, you can defeat the Sentinels, the boss enemies of Reignbreaker, to unlock extra Resolve Slots, up to a maximum of nine.

How to Spend Keys in Reignbreaker

In Reignbreaker , you can discover hidden Pop-Up Shops where you can spend Keys to unlock Artefacts. Open the map and look for the shop icon. Unlike Resolves, Keys cannot be carried over to your base camp . Upon dying, you will lose all the Keys collected during your run.

After clearing a few stages, you will enter a relaxation room where you can restore HP, unlock a new Javelin upgrade, and find a Pop-Up Shop. These shops usually offer healing and damage-boosting Artefacts. Additionally, you are guaranteed to encounter this room before a Sentinel boss fight. It is recommended that you save enough keys to purchase an HP-restoring Artefact before facing a Sentinel.

item.title: How to Reach the Highest Point on the Map in Assassin's Creed Shadows (Happy Place)
item.description:
The Assassin's Creed franchise has reached some lofty heights over the years, with Big Ben and The Great Pyramid of Gizza just two of the many iconic structures that the series has scaled over the years. However, the highest point on the map in Assassin's Creed Shadows is not man-made, but rather a geographical feature of Edo period Japan.

If players are able to find the highest point on the map in Assassin's Creed Shadows , the Happy Place Trophy / Achievement will be unlocked. However, given the sheer size of the game's world and how mountainous the south of Honshu is, finding the location in question can be fairly tricky, at least until players start to get a little closer to it.

How to Reach the Highest Point on the Map in Assassin's Creed Shadows

In Assassin's Creed Shadows , the highest point on the map is Mount Hakkyo , which can be found on the southeastern border of the Yamato province to the east of the Yoshino map marker. Upon their arrival at the synchronization point, Naoe or Yasuke will remark that they've now seen the top of the world, after which, the Happy Place Trophy / Achievement will be unlocked.

Can You Find Mount Fuji in Assassin's Creed Shadows?

Assassin's Creed Shadows takes place in central Japan, primarily in the Kansai region. Although Mount Fuji (3,776m) is around twice the height of Mount Hakkyo (1,915m), it straddles the border between the Yamanashi and Shizuoka prefectures, which are around 200 kilometers to the east of the area that players get to explore in Assassin's Creed Shadows . As such, Mount Fuji is not in the game , hence why Mount Hakkyo is the highest point on the map in Assassin's Creed Shadows .

item.title: The Best Main Story Mission Order in Assassin's Creed Shadows
item.description:
The first section of Assassin's Creed Shadows is fairly linear, but once players have completed the prologue, things begin to open up for them quite a bit. A plethora of side content becomes available right from the get-go, and they'll also be given a choice when it comes to the order that they complete some of the game's main story missions.

The first of these choices comes at the beginning of the first act when they'll need to decide whether to pursue The Golden Teppo or The Wounded first. After that, there'll be a few more choices like this one, leaving many players to wonder whether there's a best Assassin's Creed Shadows mission order. Spoiler alert; there is.

The Best Main Story Mission Order in Assassin's Creed Shadows (Onryo Kill Order)

  1. The Samurai (The Onryo Samurai)
  2. The Wounded (The Fatherless Monk)
  3. The Golden Teppo (Searching Sakai)
  4. The Fool (Bad Brother)
  5. The Naginata (An Evening in Otsu)
  6. The Mourner (A Talk with a Lady)
  7. The Noble (The Rengaki)
  8. The Ox (A Voice in Anger)
  9. The Wise (A Chance Encounter)
  10. The Fox (Red Walls)
  11. The Two-Faced (The Peasant Who Would Be King)
  12. The Horseman (The Man Behind the Mask)

Assassin's Creed Shadows Recommended Level, Explained

The above list is based on the recommended level for each of the Onryo-related missions, which can be found in the top-right-hand corner of the mission box on the Objectives board. Although it's possible to complete these missions in a different order, players will find that Naoe and Yasuke die after a single hit if they are too far below the recommended level. Worse still, their attacks will be far too weak to cause meaningful damage to even regular enemies and their assassination attempts will always fail, making progress pretty much impossible.

If and when this happens, players will need to increase their level by completing other missions or side content or equipping some better gear. If a mission is too difficult for their current setup, the recommended level will be displayed in a red diamond with a cross through it. Similarly, if an enemy is deemed too strong for the player's current level and loadout they'll have a skull next to their health bar rather than a level. It's still possible to kill them by triggering explosions or hitting them a ton of times, but doing so is seldom easy.
